Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Are an effective communicator
Are well organized, with good time management skills
Are able to work independently
Are creative
Are comfortable working as part of a team
What you’ll do here:
Transform complex data sets into meaningful conclusions and recommendations
Participate in developing completely new and innovative solutions, using machine learning, AI and statistical approaches
Get experience working with different types of data including telematics, text data and image data
Be on the lookout for new approaches and opportunities to integrate them into the solutions you design
Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:
Experience first-hand what it’s like to work as a Data Scientist and learn more about how advances in technology are shaping the way the insurance business works
Explore new ideas and learn best practices in a fun, inclusive environment
Put your creative mind to work while you help the team solve problems and contribute to challenging, meaningful projects
Be a part social events with the team, where you will meet new people and celebrate successes



Qualifications

Bachelor's, Master's or PhD in progress, in artificial intelligence, data science, computer science, mathematics, statistics or a related field
Available to work with us for a 4 month, 8 month or 12 month period (beginning in January 2022)
Practical experience in data science, Machine Learning or deep learning
Practical experience with Python or R programming languages
Knowledge of Big Data tools: Spark, Hadoop, (an asset)
Knowledge of computer visioning or natural language processing (NLP) (an asset)

Undergraduate/Graduate Mitacs Internship, Myant Response to COVID-19 Pandemic
Myant Response To COVID-19 Pandemic – Research and Technology Development for Smart Textile Solutions builds The Myant Skiin Connected Life App. It is a collaborative family informatics application which connects seniors, other family members, friends, and caregivers, to enable health and wellness related data sharing and support. Skiin differs from other products as it is based on Myant’s highly accurate intelligent textiles garments which collect activity and related biomechanical data through knitted sensors on the garment. Data are then transferred from the garment pod to the mobile Skiin app via Bluetooth. Our design seeks to deliver seamless human-computer interaction through effective data presentation, visualization, and tool tips. Data visualization is one of the core strategies that health and wellness applications use to allow individuals to manage, analyze and share their data, including for senior users. We are researching all aspects of design from visualization to user interaction to the programming needed for implementation and to add a predictive capacity, for example with heart health. This phase of the project focuses on software engineering to complete the Skiin prototype, take it to market, evaluate outcomes and improve Skiin.
Responsibilities:
With the assistance of a senior/lead developer they will research and translate product requirements into reliable, maintainable, and scalable code.
Interns will work closely with Myant UX, hardware, and data science teams to transform innovative technology into groundbreaking products.
The intern will support software research and build the next generation of user experience, linking the mobile platform built in native Android and iOS code to the Bluetooth enabled wearable clothing pod and smart textile garments.
Research and implement an interface with Bluetooth Low Energy sensors and web-based APIs, as part of Myant’s massively distributed wearable IoT platform.
Working closely with Myant UX designers, they will implement intuitive UIs.
They will research and implement an interface with Bluetooth Low Energy sensors and web-based APIs, as part of Myant’s massively distributed wearable IoT platform
They will rapidly prototype under an agile, test-driven development environment, hence learning about industry-standing rapid prototyping.
They will strengthen their ability to diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance in Agile framework.
Qualifications:
Current enrolment in a relevant undergraduate or graduate degree at OCAD University
Capacity in JavaScript, Java, and Swift programming languages.
Experience in implementing Native Android and iOS code.
Knowledge of UX design.
Data visualization skills an asset.
Interest in wearable technology.
Ability to self-teach new software, ideas, concepts, plug-ins, etc, as required for projects.
Ability to complete multiple tasks and manage any unforeseen issues.
Self-motivated.
Strong communications skills
Able to write up findings.
Hours of Work: 20 hours per week
Work Environment: On-line and 205 Richmond St W, 7th floor, Toronto, Ontario Visual Analytics Lab when the University reopens, and at Myant, Etobicoke.
Compensation: $3670 for approximately 2.5 months

Applications should include: a one-page covering letter quoting the job number and explaining the candidate’s interest, a curriculum vitae, and contact information for three (3) referees.
Interested applicants are invited to submit their application in confidence addressed to Dr. Sara Diamond, President Emerita .
The review of applications will begin as applications are received and will continue until the position has been filled.

About Sentry
Bad software is everywhere, and we're tired of it. Sentry is on a mission to help developers write better software faster, so we can get back to enjoying technology.
With more than $127 million in funding and 70,000 organizations that believe we're on to something, we're building performance and error monitoring tools that help companies like Disney, Microsoft, and Atlassian spend less time fixing bugs and more time building products. If you like to selfishly build things that make your digital life better, come help us build the next generation of software monitoring tools.
About the Role
Sentry is looking for talented new graduates to join our growing Software Engineering team. Engineers at Sentry are challenged to solve a range of technical problems: from building fast and delightful UIs for navigating millions of error and performance events, to architecting solutions that ingest, store, and index terabytes of data every day. As a Software Engineer, New Grad (2022), you will be coached by a diverse team of multi-talented engineers and will directly impact a complex and growing codebase.
In this role you will:
Work with a team to develop and extend the Sentry product by writing software in either Python or JavaScript (or both)
Be responsible for full software development lifecycle - design, development, testing, and operating in production
Communicate effectively with other engineers in the same team, with other teams, and with various other stakeholders (such as product managers)
Act on feedback, coaching, and mentorship from your manager and teammates
You'll love this job if:
You want to actively use the product you're building (we dogfood Sentry every day)
You want to start your career at a high-growth startup
You want to join a modern software development team that iterates & ships code rapidly
You're excited at the opportunity to contribute to an open-source project every day
Qualifications
B.S. or higher in Computer Science (or similar degree program) graduating in Fall 2021 or Spring 2022
At least 1 previous internship or equivalent practical experience
Implementation skills with one or more general-purpose programming languages, e.g. Python, JavaScript, Java, etc.
Good knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and object-oriented design principles
Experience working with version control and unit testing
The start date is September 2022

Job Description

The Credit Strategy Group is part of the Credit Investments (CI) department at CPP Investments. CI manages $38 billion of assets and is responsible for all of CPP Investments public and private credit investments globally. CI provides debt financing solutions across the entire credit structure, including term loans, high-yield bonds, mezzanine lending, structured products and other solutions for borrowers in all sectors. The Credit Strategy group within CI seeks to enhance the risk-adjusted returns of the CI portfolio through portfolio construction techniques that enable the CI portfolio to deliver the total fund’s desired credit exposure as well as maximize alpha generation across relative value factors such as sector, geography, rating, etc.
We are currently recruiting for an intern analyst in the Credit Strategy Group, for a four-month internship from January to April 2022. Candidates in an undergraduate program that will be graduating in December 2022 or later are eligible to apply.

Assist in the build-out of the portfolio strategy function of the recently created Credit Investments department at CPP Investments
Develop proprietary portfolio construction and monitoring tools to enhance management of the CI portfolio
Assist in the development of a relative value framework within CI to improve the effectiveness with which CI delivers a global portfolio
Other Responsibilities:
Analyzing specific investment opportunities as it relates to fit within the overall CI portfolio
Partner with other departments at CPP Investments (e.g. Total Fund Management, Finance, Analytics and Risk and Capital Markets and Factor Investing) to advance initiatives such as enhanced integration of bottom-up and top-down decision making, improved reporting and incorporation of capital markets inputs into the evaluation of prospective investment opportunities

HomeX is an end-to-end technology and services platform for both homeowners and service providers, radically improving the historically complex and fragmented home services industry.

Our technology team includes a dedicated Applied Science group, where world-leading natural language and knowledge engineers, use these skills to solve customer problems and build the HomeX consumer experience.

You diligently apply your high standards in everything you do, and you hold others to those same high standards.

Strong attention to detail

TD Asset Management Inc. Job Description
Are you ready for a challenge? We are seeking an intellectually curious person, with a high level of mathematical maturity and excellent Python skills, to join the Portfolio Research & Analytics team as a Quantitative Portfolio Research Intern/Co-op.

The models developed by the Portfolio Research & Analytics team inform the investment decision making process and help drive quantitative investment strategies. If selected for this role, you will be primarily working on enhancing and testing our models and data processing capabilities.

On any given day you may be asked to:
Analyze a risk model for potential pockets of instability, and if any are found, research their root causes
Write a data scraping script and verify the correctness of output data using both visual and quantitative methods
Tune an optimizer profile to produce trades that are consistent with the investment objective of a fund
Develop a portfolio asset-allocation strategy that maximizes the Sharpe ratio, from a given set of component returns, and perform historical backtests
Create visualizations for return and risk performance indicators using Python
Fit a factor model and test its out-of-sample performance using Python statsmodels
Teach yourself some methodology you've never heard of before, by reading a paper, and then figure out the best way to use it in order to add value to the portfolio management process
Candidates will find this role a great opportunity to leverage their strong mathematical and data analysis skills while gaining front office financial industry experience.

Why you should be excited about applying for this role:
A chance to see the results of your work have immediate real-world impact
One-on-one mentoring
Co-op events

Job Requirements
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree majoring in relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, or similar.
Must be enrolled in an undergraduate degree with the intent of going back to school at of the start of your work term
Excellent understanding of mathematics:
Linear algebra (e.g. decomposing a matrix into its eigenvectors)
Statistics (e.g. multivariate regression, covariance matrices)
Probability (numerically computing the expectation of an arbitrary function over a continuous density, finding a distribution that best fits to data)
Mental persistence to analytically explore all logical implications of an idea
Experience in implementing your ideas in software, preferably using one of the following tools
Python/pandas/numpy/scipy/statsmodels/scikit-learn
MATLAB
C++
Experience with the following would be considered an asset:
Bloomberg terminal
SQL and database design (with any major RDBMS)
Web development and JavaScript
Git version control
Familiarity with software development in a Linux-based environment
Strong time management and organization skills.
Keen interest in finance and investments. Previous experience in financial industry is not required but considered an asset.

The ideal candidate should be comfortable working in a team environment.

Graduate Mitacs Internship, Applying Generative Design to Complete Community Planning
Applying Generative Design to Complete Community Planning brings together growing computational practices in generative design with the urban design challenge of planning and building complete communities. The concept of complete communities is in part inspired by new urbanism which focuses on human and environmental needs. Transportation modes within a community and the network of access that connect complete communities are critical for their design and success. Transportation modes within a community and the network of access that connect complete communities are critical for their design and success. We will use generative design to explore the definition and design of complete communities, both de novo and as an evolution of existing communities. The research will focus on developing feasible neighbourhood designs that lead to higher-density, diverse, and vibrant communities that reduce the need to travel and provide effective options for residual travel demand and nearby services. Research will result in innovations in transportation and urban planning, design practice, in efficiencies in planning, and expansion of the Autodesk suite into large-scale urban planning.
The project is supervised by Dr. Sara Diamond in collaboration with Autodesk as the industrial partner. Autodesk has successfully used “generative design” to tackle design problems in the automotive, aerospace, construction, building information management and consumer goods industries. The computational capacities of Autodesk’s generative design will allow data sets relevant to the complete community planning process to be analyzed and multiple scenarios created which can be tested, iterated, validated, and implemented. The challenges of designing complete communities can be addressed from a variety of constraints (principles, zoning regulations and land use guidelines, community mix, building codes, or financial constraints) with amplified consultation from multiple stakeholders. Case studies will provide contemporary challenges and data. OCAD U continue to build its research capacity in geo-spatial visualization the context of the Autodesk platform. It will train an interdisciplinary intern who is a current GTHA university student who bridges urban planning and digital media/ICT. Preference will be given to OCAD U enrolled students.
Responsibilities:
Undertake literature and policy review to establish metrics that will be used to evaluate a complete community.
Collect community data that can inform the metrics and the generative model and the evaluative component. Engage with stakeholders with faculty leader and advisory team to establish and narrow the metrics. Validate metrics with stakeholders.
Undertake site visits to understand the environment and generic design challenges and engage with stakeholders.
Collect relevant data.
Evaluate candidate complete community designs in an actual case study against various criteria for complete communities such as A Place to Grow, and stakeholder consultations.
Establish metrics, summarize the metrics and their weightings undertake data collection and validation. Build the metrics that describe the objectives or goals of the design problem.
Analyze if and how existing policies, regulations and requirements limit or support the quality of the complete community designs suggested through a generative design process.
Create a prototype that tests metrics for an agreed upon sub-neighbourhood of the case study through a generative geometry model that deﬁnes a ‘design space’ of possible design solutions using computational and visualization strategies and represents trade-offs.
Apply a metaheuristic search algorithm such as a genetic algorithm to search through the design space and ﬁnd a variety of high-performing design options based on the stated objectives.
Use urban scale geometry and spatial analysis to create models and prototypes.
Refine visualization strategies to communicate metrics and related designs.
Use Revit tools to complete fully rendered design visualization for consideration by stakeholders.
Present options to stakeholders. Indicate the trade-offs inherent in reconciling the design constraints with the policy goals and residents’ willingness to live in complete communities and definitions of a complete community.
Create plans for a generative design model of the complete community.
Contribute to consideration of the workflow of an urban design project from a systems perspective, (land use, infrastructure planning, building functions and services, building massing, street characteristics, landscape and public space, amenities etc. with transportation planning, both civilian and freight) to ensure that all systems work together.
Contribute findings to the development of a generalized scorecard for complete communities that is a goal of the four-year iCity2.0 project.
